Principal Bustard Message to the Class of 2020

Jennifer Bustard
April 1 at 12:55 PM · YouTube ·

Hello Sailor Nation,
Thinking of all our students, parents, staff and community every day! We miss you terribly! Especially our seniors, the Class of 2020. A heartfelt message and letter written by our HS English Department is shared in this video. "It's not a matter of if we will honor the Class of 2020. It is a matter of when."
Seniors, cherish the memories together that have been made by sharing photos, videos and laughter. Grieve the memories not able to be had. We are right there with you. Please continue to follow us on facebook, twitter, the HS Webpage and email. It is our way to get our messages to you as we can not be with you in person.
Together we will get through this. #sailorstrong #wearebettertogether #Keepcalm #Keepanchored

Special thank you to parent, community member, and Norton Shores Fire Department leader for taking the time to put together this video on Sailor Nation. Shout out to Joe Kinnucan!

Sailor Nation-

Sailor Pride is out in full force as Winter Sports Season winds down. We have two teams competing at the State Finals this weekend:

Girls Bowling: Our Sailors head to Waterford for the State Finals on Friday, March 6th. Community Sendoff: Thursday, March 5th at 4:00 p.m. Line up near the Sailor Center entrance by 3:45 p.m.

Competitive Cheer: Our 3rd ranked Sailors will compete in the Division 2 State Finals on Saturday, March 7th at 10:00 a.m. at the Deltaplex in Grand Rapids. Community Sendoff: Friday, March 6th at 2:40 p.m. Line up near the Sailor Center entrance at 2:25 p.m.

Both teams will be escorted out of town by the Norton Shores Police and Fire Departments. We encourage our community to line Seminole Road and send our Sailors off to represent us in their quest for a State Championship.

In addition, this Friday, March 7 will be Sailor Blue day across our schools and community. We encourage you and your kids to wear your Sailor blue and show your Sailor Pride! Go Sailors!

Sailor Nation,

Go Shores!

Message from Mona Shores High School Athletics

Sailor Nation,

Just over two hours ago, our football field was clear of snow. It was melting almost as soon as it hit the grass. Unfortunately, things have taken a bit of a turn for the worse. We now have a few inches of heavy, wet snow that can only be removed with snow shovels and blowers.

The good news is that we've been here before and we know what to do. From 3:30-5:00, anybody who is able and willing should report to Sailor Stadium with a shovel and/or backpack leaf blower to help clear the field. The snow should stop by 4:00 so by 5:00, the field should be completely cleared.

If you can help, please text the word "IN" to (231) 670-5053 so I know how much help to expect. The last time this happened, we ended up in Detroit on Thanksgiving weekend. Thanks in advance for any consideration. Go Shores!

Todd Conrad
Director of Athletics
Mona Shores Public Schools
780-4711 ext. 8312

Sailor Nation,

As we prepare for yet another run in the MHSAA football playoffs, there are a few things you will want to know. Tickets go on sale at the main ticket booth at Sailor Stadium from 3-5 today and tomorrow (Thursday and Friday) for $6. As always, support of our athletes and coaches coupled with respect for our opponents and officials is what defines the Mona Shores school-community. Looking forward to tomorrow. Go Shores!

Todd Conrad

Dear Mona Shores Community,

I would like to share the following communication sent by the MAISD to alleviate rumors:

This morning multiple schools and Muskegon Community College (MCC) received phone calls with rumors of an active shooter at MCC. Schools in close proximity to MCC, MAISD offices, the Career Tech Center and Wesley School were immediately in lock-down mode as law enforcement and MCC staff investigated. Law enforcement will continue to monitor MCC, Baker, and Career Tech Center campuses throughout the day. Safety is a top priority for the MAISD and all of our education partners. We are thankful to law enforcement for their prompt response.

Sailing forward,
Greg Helmer
